title: Ripple

sections.label: Intro
sections.bar_progression: |: G | G | C | C | C | C | G :|

sections.label: Verse 1
sections.content:
[G]If my words did glow, with the gold of [C]sunshine
And my tunes were played on the harp un[G]strung,
Would you hear my voice come through the [C]music,
[G]Would you [D]hold it [C]near as it were your [G]own?

sections.label: Verse 2
sections.content:
[G]It's a hand-me-down, the thoughts are [C]broken,
Perhaps they're better left un[G]sung.
I don't know, don't really [C]care
[G]Let there be [D]songs to [C]fill the [G]air.

sections.label: Chorus
sections.content:
[Am]Ripple in still [D]water,
When there is [G]no pebble [C]tossed,
Nor [A]wind to [D]blow.

sections.label: Verse 3
sections.content:
[G]Reach out your hand if your cup be [C]empty,
If your cup is full may it be a[G]gain,
Let it be known there is a [C]fountain,
[G]That was not [D]made by the [C]hands of [G]men.

sections.label: Verse 4
sections.content:
[G]There is a road, no simple [C]highway,
Between the dawn and the dark of [G]night,
And if you go no one may [C]follow,
[G]That path is [D]for your [C]steps a[G]lone.

sections.label: Bridge
sections.content:
[G]La dee da da [C]da
La da da [G]da da
La da da [D]da da [C]da da [G]da

notes: Jerry Garcia's signature fingerpicking style. Let the notes ring and keep a steady thumb on the bass.
